required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: As-needed Budesonide/Formoterol Turbuhaler in Stepping Down Period
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of As-needed Budesonide/Formoterol Turbuhaler During Stepping Down Period From Step-3 in Adult Patients With Adequately Controlled Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy of as-needed Budesonide/formoterol Turbuhaler 160/4.5 µg/d in the period of step down in well controlled asthmatic patient comparing with standard maintenance therapy in step-2 management in asthma guildeline which is low dose inhaled corticosteroid.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will measure the efficacy of as-needed low dose ICS/ LABA in well controlled asthmatic patient comparing with low dose ICS in step down circumstance.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to First moderate/severe asthma exacerbation rate or loss of asthma controlled
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for first moderate/severe asthma exacerbation rate or loss of asthma controlled (an estimated average duration of 48 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Duration after the patients who has been randomised to developed asthma exacerbation or loss of asthma control that evaluation by Asthma Controlled Test (ACT)

primary_outcome.measure: Time to First moderate/severe asthma exacarbation rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for first moderate/severe asthma exacerbation rate (an estimated average duration of 48 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Duration after randomisation until the patients will develop asthma exacerbation.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to First loss of asthma controlled
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients will be followed for loss of asthma controlled (an estimated average duration of 48 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Duration after randomisation until the patients will have a loss of asthma control evaluating by Asthma Controlled Test (ACT)

primary_outcome.measure: The ratio of asthma controlled to total number of participants
primary_outcome.time_frame: The ratio of asthma controlled to total number of participants at week 48th.
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of participants who will be classified for asthma controlled to total number of participants by ACT score

secondary_outcome.description: The change of absoluted eosinophil count after step down medication
The change of FENO after step down medication
The amount of inhaled steroid dose throughout the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in lung function: Peak expiratory flow
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Peak expiratory flow

intervention.intervention_name: Budesonide/Formoterol Fumarate 160 MCG-4.5 MCG Inhalation Powder
intervention.description: After the patients who have all criteria, they will be randomized to take Budesonide/formoterol (160/4.5 μg/d) as need when they have symptoms.
After the patients who have all criteria, they will be randomized to take Budesonide (200 μg) twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who have been diagnosed as asthma at least 6 months.
2. Patients who have well controlled asthma by ACT > 23 and ACQ-7 < 0.75 at least 12 weeks with using budesonide/formoterol (160/4.5 μg/d) twice daily
3. Patient who not be taking oral bronchodilator such as montelukast, theophylline, doxophylline but accept for taking anti histamine and intranasal steroid.
4. Patients who able to do spirometry without contraindication.
5. Patients who have FENO < 25 ppB and absoluted eosinophil count < 300 cell/mm3.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of using systemic steroid previous 12 week and respiratory infection History of pulmonary tuberculosis with residual lung lesion by chest radiograph recent serious medical condition such as myocardial infarction, stroke, pneumonia etc.
2. History smoking less than 10 pack-years or be smoking
3. History of asthma exacabation previous 12 week
